ilo: Analyse organizational structures in schools, the role of teachers and leaders, and relevant legislative, administrative, and organizational policies and processes.
Investigate and evaluate leadership approaches in schools and their impact on teaching and learning including the use of data and strategies for reporting to students and parents/carers.
Examine teacher professionalism and teacher leadership and the role of the Australian Professional Standards for Teachers in identifying professional learning needs.
Explore and appraise appropriate sources and pathways for continued professional learning and leadership development.
Critically reflect on feedback from supervisors and teachers to improve professional knowledge and practices through a professional learning plan.

Inherent requirements (core participatio.content: Further details on how to seek academic adjustments can be found on the Student Equity and Disability Support website:http://services.unimelb.edu.au/student-equity/home

assessment.brief: Report: Case study report of a school.
Professional Learning Plan: Professional learning plan to broaden professional knowledge and skills in teaching.

assessment.hurdle: A minimum of 80% attendance at, or engagement with, all sessions identified as contact hours (may include lectures, tutorials, seminars and workshops, both synchronous and asynchronous).

date_times.contact_hours: 24 hours (16 hours of on-campus classes and 8 hours of asynchronous online activities)
